summary: Cheyenne is the capital and biggest city of Wyoming, with about 65,000 people. It's named after the Cheyenne Native American tribe and was founded in 1867. The city is in Laramie County and is part of a larger area called the Cheyenne metropolitan statistical area, which has over 100,000 residents. Cheyenne is unique because it's one of only four state capitals with a Slovakian name, and it's located in a state named after indigenous people. The city is at the end of a long mountain range and is near Crow Creek and Dry Creek.
title: Cheyenne, Wyoming
